# Testing formulas 
Based on the decomposition of $a$ and putting that on the scale of variances, we get

$$
var(m_i) = d_{ii} \sigma_a^2
$$

Based on that we can compute

$$d_{ii} = var(m_i) / \sigma_a^2$$

Für die Matrix $D^{-1}$ benötigen wir 

$$(d_{ii})^{-1} = \sigma_a^2 / var(m_i)$$
